title: HONOR Steps up its Software Support for the 400 Series
description: This will encompass several smartphones in the brand's lineup. The post HONOR Steps up its Software Support for the 400 Series appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: This will encompass several smartphones in the brand's lineup.
text: With major smartphone manufacturers like Samsung and Google now offering several years of software support for their devices, it was only a matter of time before we saw more brands implement similar strategies with regards to their own devices. READ: HONOR Teases More AI Editing Software for the 400 Series With that in mind, Honor recently announced that it’s committed to providing six years of Android updates for its upcoming Honor 400 Series, which will additionally receive the much-anticipated Android 16 upgrade as early as this year. An official statement from the company reads: Building on its long-standing collaboration with Google, HONOR is among the first to bring the latest Android experience to its users. This collaboration enables HONOR to provide developers with quick access to the latest Android releases, allowing users to experience the most recent and secure Android features without delay. The company was also among the first brands to release the Android 15 Beta last year, and the most recent Android 16 Beta 3 version has been available to developers on the Honor Magic7 Pro since May 7th. Alongside the Magic7 Pro and 400 series, the HONOR Magic V3 will also receive updates to a MagicOS version based on Android 16 in 2025.
html:
With major smartphone manufacturers like Samsung and Google now offering several years of software support for their devices, it was only a matter of time before we saw more brands implement similar strategies with regards to their own devices.

READ: HONOR Teases More AI Editing Software for the 400 Series

With that in mind, Honor recently announced that it’s committed to providing six years of Android updates for its upcoming Honor 400 Series, which will additionally receive the much-anticipated Android 16 upgrade as early as this year. An official statement from the company reads:

Building on its long-standing collaboration with Google, HONOR is among the first to bring the latest Android experience to its users. This collaboration enables HONOR to provide developers with quick access to the latest Android releases, allowing users to experience the most recent and secure Android features without delay.

The company was also among the first brands to release the Android 15 Beta last year, and the most recent Android 16 Beta 3 version has been available to developers on the Honor Magic7 Pro since May 7th. Alongside the Magic7 Pro and 400 series, the HONOR Magic V3 will also receive updates to a MagicOS version based on Android 16 in 2025.
